envPropDefs.name: CLM_REPO_USERNAME
envPropDefs.label: CLM_REPO_USERNAME
envPropDefs.description: The username to access the CLM installation repository

envPropDefs.name: CLM_REPO_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.label: CLM_REPO_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.description: The password to access the CLM installation repository, must be provided if CLM_REPO_USERNAME is provided

envPropDefs.name: CLM_MASTER_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.label: CLM_MASTER_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.description: The master password of IM secure store, must be provided if CLM_REPO_USERNAME and CLM_REPO_PASSWORD is provided

envPropDefs.name: ldap_host
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Hostname
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the LDAP server host name. This host name is either an IP address or a domain name service (DNS) name.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_port
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Port
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the LDAP server port.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_bindDN
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Bind Distinguished Name (DN)
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the distinguished name for the application server, which is used to bind to the directory service. For example, cn=root.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_bindPassword
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Bind Password
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the password for the application server, which is used to bind to the directory service.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_baseDN
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Base Distinguished Name (DN)
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the base distinguished name of the directory service, which indicates the starting point for LDAP searches in the directory service. For example, ou=Rochester, o=IBM, c=us.

envPropDefs.name: jazz_ldap_userAttributesMapping
envPropDefs.label: User Property Names Mapping
envPropDefs.description: Mapping of Jazz user property names to LDAP registry entry attribute names. The mapping should be represented as {contributorAttributeName1}={LDAPEntryAttributeName1}, {contributorAttributeName2}={LDAPEntryAttributeName2}...

envPropDefs.name: jazz_ldap_groupMapping
envPropDefs.label: Jazz to LDAP Group Mapping
envPropDefs.description: Mapping between Jazz groups and LDAP groups. One Jazz group can be mapped to multiple LDAP groups. The LDAP groups must be separated by a semi colon. For example, JazzAdmins=LDAPAdmins1;LDAPAdmins2 maps JazzAdmins group to LDAPAdmins1 and LDAPAdmins2.

envPropDefs.name: jazz_grouprole_JazzAdmins
envPropDefs.label: Jazz LDAP Group for Jazz Admins

envPropDefs.name: jazz_grouprole_JazzDWAdmins
envPropDefs.label: Jazz LDAP Group for Jazz Data Warehouse Admins

envPropDefs.name: jazz_grouprole_JazzUsers
envPropDefs.label: Jazz LDAP Group for Jazz Users

envPropDefs.name: jazz_grouprole_JazzGuests
envPropDefs.label: Jazz LDAP Group for Jazz Guests

envPropDefs.name: jazz_grouprole_JazzProjectAdmins
envPropDefs.label: Jazz LDAP Group for Jazz Project Admins

envPropDefs.name: jazz_ldap_primaryid
envPropDefs.label: Jazz Admin Username
envPropDefs.description: The username of Jazz administrative user in LDAP directory service

envPropDefs.name: jazz_ldap_primaryid_Password
envPropDefs.label: Jazz Admin Password
envPropDefs.description: The password of Jazz administrative user in LDAP directory service

envPropDefs.name: ldap_groupIdMap
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Group ID map
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter that maps the short name of a group to an LDAP entry.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_groupMemberIdMap
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Group Member ID map
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter that identifies user to group memberships.

envPropDefs.name: IM_REPO
envPropDefs.label: IM_REPO
envPropDefs.description: The repository for update the existing IBM Installation Manager, leave empty will use IBM service repository, needs public network access

envPropDefs.name: IM_REPO_USERNAME
envPropDefs.label: IM_REPO_USERNAME
envPropDefs.description: The username to access the IM repository

envPropDefs.name: IM_REPO_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.label: IM_REPO_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.description: The password to access the IM repository, must be provided if IM_REPO_USERNAME is provided

envPropDefs.name: IM_MASTER_PASSWORD
envPropDefs.label: IM_MASTER_PASSWORD

children.name: Download Artifacts

components.name: OpenSource-InstallCLI
components.description: Install IWD and IPAS command line utility

processes.name: Add user to instance
processes.description: Add a user to an IWD/IPAS virtual system instance

propDefs.name: newuser
propDefs.label: Instance User Id
propDefs.description: Id of the user to add to the IWD/IPAS virtual system instance

edges.to: Add user to virtual system instance

edges.from: Add user to virtual system instance

offsets.name: Add user to virtual system instance

properties.scriptBody:
#!/bin/sh
# Check if CLI was downloaded
if [ ! -d cli ]
then
    echo "Download CLI component process was not run"
    exit 1
fi

# Check if running IWD or IPAS
if [ -d cli/deployer.cli ]
then
    CLISCRIPT=cli/deployer.cli/bin/deployer
elif [ -d cli/pure.cli ]
then
    CLISCRIPT=cli/pure.cli/bin/pure
fi
if [ -z $CLISCRIPT ]
then
    echo "No CLI script found"
    exit 1
fi

# Create the CLI command file
echo "instance = deployer.virtualsystems['${p:application.name}-${p:environment.name}'][0]" > adduser.txt
echo "user = deployer.users['${p:newuser}'][0]" >> adduser.txt
echo "instance.acl[user] = deployer.ALL_PERMISSIONS" >> adduser.txt

# Execute the CLI
# Hardcode cliuser and clipassword until workitem 110302 is fixed.
$CLISCRIPT -h ${p:cloudhost} -u ratlauto@us.ibm.com -p ratlauto -f adduser.txt

children.name: Add user to virtual system instance

processes.name: Download CLI
processes.description: Download the IWD/IPAS CLI zipfile and extract it

propDefs.name: downloadhost
propDefs.label: IWD/IPAS Hostname
propDefs.description: Name or IP of the IWD/IPAS host to download CLI zip from

edges.from: Set cloudhost property for use by following processes

edges.to: Set cloudhost property for use by following processes

offsets.name: Set cloudhost property for use by following processes

properties.scriptBody:
#!/bin/sh
if [ ! -d cli ]
then
    mkdir cli
fi
cd cli
curl --insecure --output CLI.zip https://${p:downloadhost}/downloads/cli/

# Unzip the CLI
unzip CLI.zip

children.name: Set cloudhost property for use by following processes

components.name: OpenSource-WAS
components.description: Contains the process and scripts can help us configure WAS

envPropDefs.name: ldap_host
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Hostname
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the LDAP server host name. This host name is either an IP address or a domain name service (DNS) name.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_port
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Port
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the LDAP server port.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_bindDN
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Bind Distinguished Name (DN)
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the distinguished name for the application server, which is used to bind to the directory service. For example, cn=root.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_bindPassword
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Bind Password
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the password for the application server, which is used to bind to the directory service.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_baseDN
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Base Distinguished Name (DN)
envPropDefs.description: Specifies the base distinguished name of the directory service, which indicates the starting point for LDAP searches in the directory service. For example, ou=Rochester, o=IBM, c=us.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_userIdMap
envPropDefs.label: LDAP User ID map
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter that maps the short name of a user to an LDAP entry.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_userFilter
envPropDefs.label: LDAP User Filter
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter clause for searching the user registry for users.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_groupIdMap
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Group ID map
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter that maps the short name of a group to an LDAP entry.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_groupFilter
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Group Filter
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter clause for searching the user registry for groups.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_groupMemberIdMap
envPropDefs.label: LDAP Group Member ID map
envPropDefs.description: Specifies a LDAP filter that identifies user to group memberships.

envPropDefs.name: ldap_primaryid
envPropDefs.label: WAS Admin User ID
envPropDefs.description: The user ID of WAS Admin User in LDAP directory

envPropDefs.name: ldap_primaryid_Password
envPropDefs.label: WAS Admin User Password
envPropDefs.description: The password of WAS Admin User in LDAP directory

envPropDefs.name: ldap_sslEnabled
envPropDefs.label: LDAP with SSL
envPropDefs.description: Specifies whether secure socket communications is enabled with the LDAP server. When this option is set to true, LDAP SSL settings are used.
